instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message:
Good Day, got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, has history of water damage, board was cleaned off, not getting a green light and no power. what will i need to check?
there is no pp3v42
and <SIGNAL>PP20V_DCIN_FUSE</SIGNAL> - 16.7V
adapter sense 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message:
UPDATE:

DIODE MODE <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
PIN17/18 - 3.4 Ohms
PIN27/28 - 20,9 Ohms

Voltages on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
2 - 16.5V
3- 3.8V
19-5.54V
20 - 5.54V
1 - 0.01V
26- 14.32V
9 - 0.02V
15- 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message:
Lets start with restoring 3.42v rail. Have you checked for any shorts on this line ?

Diode mode measurement on L7090
Voltage on <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message:
Hi are you dure about L7090, doesnt seem the be on this board
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> Pin 1 16.7V and Pin 2 0.27V. Looks corroded so ill replace that now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message: [USER="461"]Gurmon[/USER] Great News replaced <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> and machine fired right up :D:D. everything seems to be working as should however the machine does appear to be running rather slugish. Has anyone come across such an issue after water damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message: Run internal diagnostics and see if anything fails. Could be a bad battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message: Good news, i meant L7095......long day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green light
threads.message: Run diagnostic to see if any errors appear. Make sure battery is working and charging.
